author: terence0083
content:
Heads up, we probably want to support this moving forward or else it could become a nighmare for the code to rebase on top of capella: https://github.com/ethereum/execution-apis/pull/314/files

Once it's merged, I'll open an engine API PR to align that with v3 endpoint

author: terence0083
content: Also, do we want https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/pull/3095 ? I'd love to include this and blockValue for devnet3 so it'll make the rebasing life easier down the line. Perhaps we can name the current devnet3 as pre-devnet3 and do another devnet3 with the latest engine api and withdrawal spec

author: g11tech
content: yes pls for above two PRs, they are already part of lodestar code base, for 314, we also have some handling for old format, but it would be difficult to revert 3095 and have withdrawals

author: g11tech
content: so for devnet 4, i vote for withdrawals enabled with both PRs included

author: __flcl
content: Hi! Prysm says no peers for any devnet, what can it be? Can it be a a peer ban or like that? I check all the options  --bootstrap-node, yaml and ssz configs

author: terence0083
content: Yeah we need to fix the rate limiter
